intro: Elatostema pulleanum, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettle plants, and is characterized by its small, ovate leaves with a velvety texture. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has a low-growing habit. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant, and it produces small, dry fruits. Elatostema pulleanum is often found in disturbed soils and can be invasive in certain areas.
